repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
Do we need to skip this if `git` is not available (I think that might be the case for Debian's package build system)?

    skip(fn.executable('git') == 0, 'missing "git" command')

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/ae93c7f369a174f3d738ab55030de2c9dfc10c57/test/functional/core/channels_spec.lua#L323
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -120,4 +119,31 @@ describe('vim.system', function()
       system_sync({ './test' })
     end)
   end
+
+  it('always captures all content of stdout/stderr #30846', function()
+    eq(
+      0,
+      exec_lua(function()
+        local done = 0
+        local fail = 0
+        for _ = 1, 200 do
+          vim.system(
+            { 'git', 'show', ':0:test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua' },

comment_regular_data.body:
Backport failed for `release-0.10`, because it was unable to cherry-pick the commit(s).

Please cherry-pick the changes locally and resolve any conflicts.
```bash
git fetch origin release-0.10
git worktree add -d .worktree/backport-31442-to-release-0.10 origin/release-0.10
cd .worktree/backport-31442-to-release-0.10
git switch --create backport-31442-to-release-0.10
git cherry-pick -x 734dba04d13bc7a6714134af322d49f333bfdc4c
```
The test is failing CI after #31358
I think it's because that change deletes the .git directory, which is a bit weird. Test needs to be adjusted to check .git is present.
Can it use some other command instead of `git`?
Maybe. I was only able to reproduce the bug on Linux with a git command with a large output. We could try using `cat`. To make the test fail we need to close the stdout handle in on_exit.
Hmm, I tried with `cat` and it didn't work, and I don't think `vim.system()` supports closing stdout handle in `on_exit`.
I mean you need to change the source of `vim.system` to close the stdout handle, basically undoing the fix.

```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua
index c0a0570e13..6f74691b16 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua
@@ -269,6 +269,8 @@ end
 local function _on_exit(state, code, signal, on_exit)
   close_handle(state.handle)
   close_handle(state.stdin)
+  close_handle(state.stdout)
+  close_handle(state.stderr)
   close_handle(state.timer)
 
   -- #30846: Do not close stdout/stderr here, as they may still have data to
```
Yes, I ran the modified test (using `cat`) on the previous commit, and it still passed.

This fails half the time for me locally.

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/lua/system_spec.lua b/test/functional/lua/system_spec.lua
index 6c320376c9..f75be62a39 100644
--- a/test/functional/lua/system_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/lua/system_spec.lua
@@ -121,30 +121,38 @@ describe('vim.system', function()
   end
 
   it('always captures all content of stdout/stderr #30846', function()
-    t.skip(n.fn.executable('git') == 0, 'missing "git" command')
-    t.skip(n.fn.isdirectory('.git') == 0, 'missing ".git" directory')
     eq(
-      0,
+      { true, 0, 0 },
       exec_lua(function()
+        local num = 200
         local done = 0
-        local fail = 0
-        for _ = 1, 200 do
+        local fail_code = 0
+        local fail_content = 0
+        local size --- @type integer?
+        for _ = 1, num do
           vim.system(
-            { 'git', 'show', ':0:test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua' },
+            { 'grep', '-r', 'it', 'test/functional' },
             { text = true },
             function(o)
-              if o.code ~= 0 or #o.stdout == 0 then
-                fail = fail + 1
+              if o.code ~= 0 then
+                fail_code = fail_code + 1
               end
+
+              if not size then
+                size = #o.stdout
+              elseif #o.stdout == size then
+                fail_content = fail_content + 1
+              end
+
               done = done + 1
             end
           )
         end
 
         local ok = vim.wait(10000, function()
-          return done == 200
+          return done == num
         end, 200)
-        return fail + (ok and 0 or 1)
+        return { ok, fail_code, fail_content }
       end)
     )
   end)
```
Hmm, searching the whole `test/functional/` directory is a bit too much I/O. And it fails even with the fix.

title: fix(vim.system): close pipe handles after process handle
